answers.answer: In a tablet form to help you, you  can buy some antihistamines from the pharmacy or from large supermarkets.It would be a good idea to be seen by the doctor to try and establish what the cause is of the all over itching.You may have an allergy from something that you have touched or eaten, an allergy to a shampoo, bath lotion or soap that you use.  An allergy to a washing detergent, or other chemical that you come into contact with.It can be from a bug called scabies, a bug bite or animal bite that may have spread infection.  You may have diabetes with high sugar levels.Look at shampoos and shower gels that you use and notice if your itching gets worse when you use these.  Think about if you have been near any plants recently that you may have brushed past.  Vacuum your bed and wash the bed linen in case there are any bugs hiding in crevices.Have you been swimming anywhere?  Have any animals?  Just something to think about.You may have a eczema type of condition.The other thing to think about is how long have you had this, is this a long term thing, or suddenly happened.If you do suffer from a skin disorder you will be able to buy an emollient from the pharmacy to use instead of soap.  Soap is very drying and will make the itching even worse.  The doctor would be able to prescribe a much stronger antihistamine that you can purchase yourself, as well as any emollient bath lotions.If you are not able to see a doctor, the pharmacist will also be able to give you advice and recommend what you can use.Any calomine based cream or lotion will help to ease the itching, but it is a bit difficult if you have it in your head too.
